result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Morrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert J Morrison is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert J Morrison was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Robert J Morrison was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Check in with MH professional at least every other month. Take all prescribed medication as prescribed.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: 11/4/16 Crt imposes as a condition of probation 30 days in the DCJ for violation of probation stayed for compliance with probation.

miscConds.notes: Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.
